sub_title: Former Agricultural Counsellor Egypt & Jordan, incoming strategic policy advisor Africa
summary:
Inspired strategic advisor on international cooperation policy and practice between the Netherlands and Africa. Driven to contribute to equitable, priciple based cooperation from business to bussiness, government to government, people to people. 

Passionate about professional and civic peer to peer exchange of knowledge and inspration aimed at socialtal learning, leadership development and transitions to sustainable production and consumption. 

Wageningen trained social scientist convinced of the planetary need for trans-diciplinary applied research. Graduate and fellow of the African Studies Centre at Leiden. Career civil servant and diplomat dedicated to international collaboration and inter-cultural understanding. Father of two girls, inter-dependent husband, thus stakeholder in the women's movement and LGBT+ ally.

I only LinkIn with people I have met in person. 
Feel free to follow me. I aspire to be truthful, genuine and balanced in my posts and assume consent. If any of my posts offend or cause discomfort, please let me know with a comment or a direct message and I will see how best to address this.

Between 2006 and July 2008, I spent one day a week and one month a year on this project. This provided three short field work visits to Zambia. Between August 2008 and July 2009, I made use of study leave under the "Promotieregeling Buitenlandse Zaken". This allowed me to work full time on this research, including three and a half months of field work in Zambia. 
Between August 2009 and December 2011, I finalised the dissertation, which was succesfully defended in Leiden on 14 March 2012.
